page.title: 08CURRIE LOCAL SHOP
page.content: On Wednesday 22nd of May at 1.30pm, I interviewed Mr.S. The newsagents has been there for 75 years and Mr.S has been in the newsagent business for 21 years now. He works from Monday to Sunday, twelve hours a day. He gets up each morning at 6.00am to make up the runs for the newspaper boys. He has two assistants, his wife and daughter, without whom his life would be very hard. Mr.S's shop sells practically everything, including a vast range of magazines, from Beanos and Dandys to Harpers and Queens. He has half an hour for his breakfast and an hour and a half for his lunch. His spare time is spent playing bowls and attending to his 85 or more racing pigeons.
